Timer#

Here, the class Timer is shown and described.

class Timer#

Public Functions

inline Timer()#

Constructor which sets the start time to now.

inline Timer(const Timer &time)#

Constructor which sets the start and end time to a specific time.

Parameters:

time – Timer which has a start and end time

void break_start() noexcept#

Stop the time measurement temporarily.

void break_stop() noexcept#

Continue the time measurement after a temporary break.

std::string clock() noexcept#

Convert ticks to time format.

Note

Prints a warning if the timer was not stopped before

Returns:

Time in the format ‘hh:mm:ss,ms’

double getMS() noexcept#

Get actual passed time in ms.

Author

Lucas

Returns:

time in ms

double getS() noexcept#

Get actual passed time in s.

Returns:

time in seconds

uint64_t getUS() noexcept#

Get actual passed time in µs.

Author

Lucas

Returns:

time in µs

void print(std::string text = "", bool format_print = false, bool newline = true) noexcept#

Pint time formatted or in ms.

Parameters:

  • text – A text printed first without a newline

  • format_print – Print by using the function range (false : in ms)

  • newline – Print with a newline

std::string range() noexcept#

return the time depending on the time value itself

Author

Mike

Returns:

returns the time in µs, ms, s or as a clock

void start() noexcept#

Start time measurement.

Author

Lucas

double stop() noexcept#

Stops the time measurement.

Author

Lucas

Returns:

passed time in ms

std::string str() noexcept#

Returns the milliseconds between start and end as a string.

Note

Prints a warning if the timer was not stopped before

Returns:

Time with the unit “ms”

time strct() noexcept#

Get a structure with the meantime.

Note

The structure is not in the format of a time. If the meantime is 1 ms, the structure will have s=0, ms = 1 and µs = 1000

Returns:

Structure with the meantime in µs, ms, s, min and hours

time strct_clock() noexcept#

Get a structure with the meantime in the format of a clock hh:mm::ss,ms.

Returns:

Structure with the meantime in µs, ms, s, min and hours

double ticks_to_double(std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::time_point ticks, double f = 1.0)#

Convert ticks to double.

Parameters:

  • ticks – Time point to which the passed time is computed

  • f – Factor which determines the unit (1.0 = µs, 1000.0 = ms, 1.0e6 = s)

Returns:

Return time passed between start and end

int toInt() noexcept#

Returns the milliseconds between start and end.

Note

Prints a warning if the timer was not stopped before

Returns:

milliseconds as an integer

Friends

inline friend std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &out, mml::Timer &time) noexcept#

Output the time as a string via a stream in ms.

Parameters:

  • out – output stream

  • time – Timer

Returns:

ostream

next

Unix
